titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Papers Relating to Blind Date and New Blind Date
Blind Date and New Blind Date (Papers Relating to)
titlestmt.author: by Michael L. Forstrom

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:53

did.unittitle: Papers relating to Blind Date and New Blind Date

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection consists of production files, audio recordings, and printed and other materials relating to the literary magazines Blind Date and New Blind Date. The production files contain submissions of short fiction, poetry, interviews, and reviews, many from San Francisco area writers, including instructors and students at the New College of California poetics program. Contributors include: Tom Clark, Diane Di Prima, Edward Dorn, Jack Foley, Gloria Frym, Dick Gallup, Amy Gerstler, Jack Hirschman, Anselm Hollo, Bill Knott, Richard Kostelanetz, Jonathan Lethem, David Meltzer, Eileen Myles, Alice Notley, Andrew Schelling, and others. In additon to the production files, there are several audio recordings of interviews with Bay Area writers and artists, including Jim Carroll, Howard Hart, and William Talcott, as well as the vendor's item-level description of the archive.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books, Inc. on the Alfred Z. Baker, Jr. Fund, 2006.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Restricted Fragile materials in Box 5 may only be consulted with permission of the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Papers Relating to Blind Date and New Blind Date is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers Relating to Blind Date and New Blind Date. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Blind Date (1987-1991) and New Blind Date (1997-1998)
bioghist.p: Blind Date (1987-1991), a literary magazine edited in Berkeley, California by novelist and poet Owen Hill, published short fiction, poetry, and interviews. New Blind Date (1997-1998), also edited by Hill, ran as a limited edition newsletter focused on the contemporary poetry scene, with reviews, gossip, short fiction, and poetry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of production files, audio recordings, and printed and other materials relating to the literary magazines Blind Date and New Blind Date. The production files contain submissions of short fiction, poetry, interviews, and reviews, many from San Francisco area writers, including instructors and students at the New College of California poetics program. Contributors include: Tom Clark, Diane Di Prima, Edward Dorn, Jack Foley, Gloria Frym, Dick Gallup, Amy Gerstler, Jack Hirschman, Anselm Hollo, Bill Knott, Richard Kostelanetz, Jonathan Lethem, David Meltzer, Eileen Myles, Alice Notley, Andrew Schelling, and others. In additon to the production files, there are several audio recordings of interviews with Bay Area writers and artisits, including Jim Carroll, Howard Hart, and William Talcott, as well as the vendor's item-level description of the archive.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Production Files, 1979-1998. II. Other Materials, 1987-2005.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I. Production Files is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains files for contibutors to both Blind Date and New Blind Date magazines, consisting chiefly of submissions of poetry, short fiction, and reviews. There are holograph and typescript drafts, photocopies, and computer printouts of word processing and e-mail files. Some files contain correspondence to magazine editor Owen Hill.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II. Other Materials is organized into three subseries: Audio Recordings of Interviews, Printed Material, and Other.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The three subseries include audio cassette recordings of interviews with writers, printed copies of issues of Blind Date and New Blind Date, as well as covers and corrected proofs, and other material.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 5 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

The program begins abruptly. The recording drops out at the beginning of the tape. There is static on the recording. The right channel was recorded at a lower volume on the tape. There is high background noise on the audio.
